post_content:
Catch me sitting by the mailbox till August 4th #MidnightSun pic.twitter.com/I1NuOKubr4

— 🌫 (@dianaxesther) May 10, 2020
Truth be told, this is uncannily similar to how Edward Cullen spent his time hanging out in Bella’s room while she slept. It seems like that's exactly how we're going to spend our time: waiting by the mailbox for the book to arrive.
sub_category: It’s Twilight Time, Again, and the Internet Can't Keep Calm
sub_category_description: Fast forward 12 years and the Twilight fans have something to look forward to in these unusual times. Sneak a peek at the fans’ reactions to #MidnightSun. You might find a great chunk of people that have their calendars booked for the 4th of August. If you are wondering what we are talking about, you probably have been spending your quarantine in a cave—a bat cave—perhaps. To bring you up to speed, Stephanie Meyer has decided to reward her fans with Midnight Sun, a companion novel retelling Twilight from Edward’s POV. Her announcement has caused quite a stir in the Twilight fandom, and since then, Twitteratis haven’t been able to contain their excitement and, um, disappointment.

post_title: To read or not to read?
post_content: Do I need to reread twilight? Because honestly that's all I've been thinking about since the announcement of #midnightsun 🤷 (whispers : what's wrong with meeeeeee) pic.twitter.com/6erXIBQAtG< Brushing up on the basics seems like a good idea, actually. It gives us all enough time to come up with a what-to-expect list by the time August rolls around. And tbh, we just need another reason to read Twilight again … and again./p>— Charlee Wilson (@Charlee_w90) May 17, 2020

post_title: 20 something and still stoked about Twilight
post_content:
I may be in my mid 20s but I’m still excited about #midnightsun Os that wrong?

— Jacquelyn E (@jac_ofnotrades) May 17, 2020
“Age is just a number.” This is the mantra we are gonna live by till we get our hands on Stephenie Meyer’s new baby. Judge all you want, haters; we're going to read this book because it doesn't matter that we're 20 or 50.

post_content:
Still can't believe that in only a matter of months all of my 13 year old dreams will be coming true #midnightsun

— All Booked Up (@AllBookedUpE) May 17, 2020
To be fair, we still think this is all a big dream our over-bored, perpetually-stuck-in-the-house mind has conjured up. But believe it or not, it's true, and we're rooting for this vampire-human love story to evoke pleasant memories of our adolescence.

The saddest thing in #Twilight has to be how Bella was so desperate to be w Edward bc he couldnt live without her and she never known how that felt & bc of the Cullens. She wanted a big loving family who she could always count on. Thats why she wanted to get married & have a baby

TO THE FIRST LUCKY BITCH WHO GETS #MIDNIGHTSUN AND INSTEAD OF READING AND ENJOYING THE SHIT OUT OF IT, STARTS SHARING THINGS AND PHRASES: I’M GONNA FIND YOU, AND I’M GONNA KILL YOU. AND THEN STEAL YOUR BOOK. I’VE WAITED TOO MUCH FOR THIS FOR YOU TO SPOIL IT.
